Utilities

src.utils.overlay_segmentation_on_image(segmentation_slice: numpy.array, image: numpy.array, header: List[Tuple[int, int]], alpha=0.6)[source]

Overlays a segmentation mask ontop of a dicom image. Performs on a single slice

Parameters

  • segmentation_slice (np.array) – mask image for a single slice

  • image (np.array) – dicom image that serves as a base image

  • header (tp.List[tp.Tuple[int, int]]) – header for the segmentation map depicting the lesion ROI

  • alpha (float, optional) – alpha value to use when blending, defaults to 0.4

Returns

overlay of the lesion ontop of the relevant slice

Return type

PIL.Image.Image

src.utils.parse_file_to_database(file_name: str, col_name: str, num_rows_to_parse_before_dump: int = 100000, config_name: Optional[str] = 'omics-database', create_index: Optional[bool] = True, validate_values: bool = True, sep='\t', insert_as_table: bool = False)[source]

Parses a dataframe from disk into mongodb with the following convention:

{
    patient: <patient_name>,
    name: <feature_name>,
    value: <feature_value>
}

The function will parse 1e6 entries and insert them to the database rather than inserting each one to conserve time.

Parameters

  • col (pymongo.collection.Collection) – pymongo collection object to insert data into

  • df (dask.dataframe.Dataframe) – dataframe to read rows from. Should be sorted such that the first item in each row is the feature value

  • patients (tp.List[str]) – list of patient identification barcodes

Returns
